title.narrative: 3. ABANDONMENT OF CHILD MARRIAGE AND FGM/C

description.narrative: By 2020, families, communities, children and adolescents (girls/boys) in the target areas, and in society in general, are better informed and equipped to abandon FGM/C, child marriage and violence., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, families, communities, children and adolescents (girls/boys) in the target areas, and in society in general, are better informed and equipped to abandon FGM/C, child marriage and violence.

description.narrative: Throughout the year, UNICEF-Burkina Faso technically and financially supported the national campaign “Don't call me Madam” for elimination of child marriage (CM). The campaign was launched in March 2019 by the First Lady and the Minister of Education and has reached more than one million people through community outreach and social media activities. This year, 1,059 new villages in three regions, including those affected by emergency, declared abandonment of female genital mutilations (FGM), CM and violence against children (VAC). At individual level, UNICEF and partners identified and protected 290,700 girls who were at risk or affected by CM and/or FGM. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020
